result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark E. Garlow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders bond on file of $150 be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark E. Garlow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: 1:49m case called. Defendant Mark E. Garlow in court with attorney William O. Marquis.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amend Count 1 to Disorderly Conduct w/o Repeater enhancer.  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed-restitution request withdrawn.  Plea: Guilty under Alford. Court accepts plea finds Guilty and enters JOC. Court dismisses repeater enhancer. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Marquis. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond applied. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Resolution has been reached-trial can be canceled & plea/sentencing date set.

Case called @ 2:09 p.m. Defendant Mark E. Garlow in court with attorney William O. Marquis.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court addresses the 906.09 motion and impeachment of prior criminal record. Atty Marquis voices an objection to the number of prior convictions requested by the State. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding the number of prior convictions. The Court orders that the number of prior convictions to be stated by the DE should he testify is five. Atty Marquis again voices an objection to the number of prior convictions. The Court affirms his previous decision. The Court grants the motions in limine filed by the State. The Court grants the motion by Atty Marquis regarding the defendant's repeater status. The Court addresses the State's 906.09 motion for the witness T.L.  The Court determines that the number of convictions to be stated by T.L. while he is testifying is five. The State must reduce the offer to the DE to writing which the parties must sign and provide to the Court the day of trial. The offer will remain under seal.
Restitution Summary and Statement of Loss/Damage - $3982.55
State's Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions - Victim's
State's Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions - Defendant's

Final pre-trial on June 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on July 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney William O. Marquis in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Marquis requesting a jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars unless in furtherance of his employment at Johann's, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:52 PM: Defendant Mark E. Garlow in court with attorney William O. Marquis.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.   ADA argues for $150 cash bond w/conditions.  No objection to bond request.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 03:20 pm.
